pageTitle: Itinerary for Thursday, June 6, 2019 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

London, United Kingdom

8:15 a.m. The Prime Minister will depart for Deauville, France.

Closed to media.
 

Deauville, France

10:10 a.m. The Prime Minister will arrive in Deauville, France.

Deauville Normandie Airport
14130 Saint-Gatien-des-Bois

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

Courseulles-sur-Mer, France

11:40 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Prime Minister of France, Édouard Philippe.

Multifunction Room
Juno Beach Centre
Voie des Français Libres

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

12:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the D-Day 75th Anniversary Canadian National Commemorative Ceremony, and will deliver remarks. Minister of Veterans Affairs and Associate Minister of National Defence Lawrence MacAulay and Minister of National Defence Harjit Sajjan will be in attendance.

Juno Beach
Voie des Français Libres

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

6:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the D-Day 75th Anniversary French International Commemorative Ceremony, and will deliver remarks.Minister of Veterans Affairs and Associate Minister of National Defence Lawrence MacAulay and Minister of National Defence Harjit Sajjan will be in attendance.

Juno Beach
Voie des Français Libres

Note for media:

  • Open coverage
